isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON 16709 AND 16710 SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION AND SHIMMING PROCEDURE

note.para: The following procedure can be completed in both the horizontal and vertical positions. Care must be taken when the procedure is completed in the horizontal as parts may shift and cause damage to the auxiliary countershaft bearing covers.
The front box sliding clutches must be in the neutral position.

step1.para: With the transmission set in the vertical position, block under the clutch housing to prevent the transmission from tipping or causing damage to the input shaft ( Figure 204). Lower the auxiliary assembly on the front case rear.

figure.caption: Figure 204. Auxiliary Assembly Lowered On Case

note.para: The auxiliary section should be engaged in gear so the auxiliary section output yoke can be rotated.

step1.para: Install the retaining bolts in the auxiliary housing flange ( Figure 205). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N• m).
Remove the center bolt from each shim gauge and loosen the two cover bolts ( Figure 206).
Each bolt (3/8" × 1" ) must have clean threads (no thread adhesive applied to the threads) with no lockwasher ( Figure 207). Threads in case must also be free of thread adhesive.
Turn bolts until they contact the shim gauge surface, then tighten the bolts to 7 in-lbs. (0.8 N• m). DO NOT INSTALL THE COUNTERSHAFT REAR BEARING COVER GASKETS ( Figure 208).

Rotate the output shaft six times in the clockwise direction, then six times counterclockwise to seat the countershaft rear bearings. Use a feeler gauge to measure the clearance between the shim gauge and the auxiliary housing next to each bolt location ( Figure 209). Record each measurement and average the two measurements. Refer to the SPECIFICATIONS CHART. Select the number in the 1st column that corresponds to the average measurement recorded. Follow the column to the right to identify the proper shim required by thickness, part number and shim color. Repeat this procedure for the remaining countershaft.

After the correct shim has been selected, place the shim on the rear countershaft bearing race, and install the countershaft rear bearing cover and gasket ( left, Figure 210). Check for cover shim alignment. If misaligned, the bearing cover may be damaged when the cover bolts are tightened (right). Perform this procedure on the remaining rear countershaft.

figure.caption: Figure 210. Install Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover

note.para: This procedure can be performed with a .100 gauging shim and the existing rear bearing covers; follow the same procedure.
There is a separate shim requirement when an auxiliary countershaft oil pump is being installed.
